column5: Not a big fan of ice fishing but do need some ice to move a boathouse this winter. Was thinking about next summer already. Thought I would share a day from last summer with some pics.  First coffee....  second coffee  My youngest son hanging out on the dock.  Our piece of heaven.  Our granddaughters prize  An afternoon/evening fish  Evening fun
Great "torture" Nipp! Can't wait for spring....  That main land or Island?

Great pictures Nip..Blimey everyone posting pictures of sandy beaches and beautiful lake pics is making me sick....lol...Man i wish i was some where hot & sunny right now with a nice ice cold drink sat in the hot sunshine and a rod n reel in my other hand...AHH!!!  A couple of pictures i took last summer while out on the  lake across the street from me.

Its on an island Irish..its why im going stir crazy..spent just about every weekend out there last winter. So far cant get there. A fellow on an island about a half mile away gave me a boathouse. Hes building a bigger one. Been waiting for thick enough ice to move it to my dock.  Nice pics...The red sunset is sensational Nauti. Like you said..Makes you want to be there
Great pics. I'm all ready thinking of may all ready, can't wait for the warm weather now.
My wife and I started fishing again in Mid-August of last year.  We are addicts again!  Cant wait til Spring...and have a whole season to fish...ahh....cant wait!

Nippissing, thanks for those pictures, it looks like you really do have a little slice of Heaven up there.  I especially like your 1st picture, there's not a better way to start the day than sipping a coffee while watching the sun come up across the lake  There's also not a better way to end the day either, than sitting around the fire with family.
Nice pictures for sure.  Thanks for posting.
awesome!  I spent alot of time fishing in the south bay in summer 2006!  Lots of islands to fish and great scenery shots!  You are one lucky fellow having a place up there!  Cheers!

Hi all...Im there almost all the time in summer. Except for work time(8-5 weekdays). So if anyone ever wants to stop by please feel welcome any time to stop in. I will even put on a pot of coffee for Lew if he can get up that early  .

Hey Nip, I go by your place a couple times a year, and I'm ALWAYS early, so don't be too surprised if you hear me banging on your door about 3:00 AM some day lookin for that coffee  And donuts too, I like donuts with my coffee
Ok Lew i kind of figured you for an early riser. Coffee ok but you may have to bring the donuts. Im a long way from a Timmies.
That really is torutre. Thanks, now im gonna be home sick and depressed until summer time in ontario again
Thats a gorgeous place you got there!
Nice place Nip, that boathouse should increase you're dock fishing numbers as well.
Looks like a piece of paradise... Just five more months until my fishing trip in June... sigh...  Mike
I count my blessings that I had a Grandfather that had foresight way back in the 1920's. It was like I won a lottery when I inherited it. I have a great family.

ah...so hey nipissing thats what paradise looks like...   just how i pictured it..  ..very nice piece of real estate you have there and a wonderful family..so when are we all going up there to catch a few fish  ,get a tan....you know all that cool fun stuff that you do in a place called PARADISE......cheers
Hey FD...If there is open blue water I'm there (minus working hours  ). Coffees on till 10am....After that time... well its wide open for what ever quenches your thirst.
